message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.CR, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the combinatorial aspects of locally repairable codes (LRCs) and their connection to matroid theory. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.IT (Information Theory), which deals with coding theory and its applications. The paper also involves constructions of matroids, which are combinatorial objects, making cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) another likely category. The paper also involves the study of bounds and nonexistence results, which are typical topics in cs.CC (Computational Complexity) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Finally, the paper involves the construction of new LRCs, which can be considered as a topic in cs.SI (Systems and Control).
